Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2007 06:38AM Greenjeans wrote: Summons, I've had 2 lumpectomys,1st one August 3rd. the second one Sept. 21st. Dr. got really wide margins with the second one. It is very common to have to have a second surgery for clean margins.One the first one I had a needle localization and lumpectomy. I was right on the edge of being clear but the Dr. was concerned that he may have missed a trace. He removed 40 grams of tissue on the second one. Mine was 6mm,DCIS stage 0, grade 2, cribiform and solid pattern  ER+/PR+. very small, only that one spot. My 1st sugery was hell, the second one I breezed through. My husband worked in surgery for 11 years and said he has never seen anyone go in so upbeat, talking like crazy and come out the same way. My advice is to read all you can, go with you gut, be your own boss and do whats right for you. Lumpectomy was the way to go for me and I've decided,- that I more than likely will not do rads. or Tamoxifin. I have already had a hysterectomy - 3 yrs. ago- still have my overies. I had horrible endometrosis( spelling??) and have been having menapausal symptoms for years- hot flashes, night sweets. I'll get my hormone levels checked to see if my overies are shutting down or how far they are. I'm only 44 and very healthy and in good physical shape and I want to hold on to that as long as I can. No guarentees in life thats for sure.Oh and PRAY all you can if your a praying woman. God has touched my life and I thank him for that. Keep us posted this is a great site and there very stong ladied here. Oh check out the Oct. issue of Self magazine there is a large artical about BC. I have not finished it yet, so I dont know where it is going with issues of BC. Take Care Jeanne
